problem_names:
lemma unfoldE:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi
  and   s :: "(name \<times> name) list"

  assumes "P \<simeq> Q"

  shows "P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q"
  and   "Q \<leadsto><weakBisim> P"

lemma unfoldI:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi

  assumes "P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q"
  and     "Q \<leadsto><weakBisim> P"

  shows "P \<simeq> Q"

lemma eqvtI:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi
  and   perm :: "name prm"

  assumes "P \<simeq> Q"

  shows "(perm \<bullet> P) \<simeq> (perm \<bullet> Q)"

lemma strongBisimWeakEq:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "P \<simeq> Q"

lemma congruenceWeakBisim:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi

  assumes "P \<simeq> Q"

  shows "P \<approx> Q"

lemma reflexive:
  fixes P :: pi
  
  shows "P \<simeq> P"

lemma symetric:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi
  
  assumes "P \<simeq> Q"
  
  shows "Q \<simeq> P"

lemma transitive:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi
  and   R :: pi
  
  assumes "P \<simeq> Q"
  and     "Q \<simeq> R"
  
  shows "P \<simeq> R"

lemma strongBisimWeakEq:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi

  assumes "P \<sim> Q"

  shows "P \<simeq> Q"
have "\<And>P Q. P \<leadsto>[bisim] Q \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       P \<leadsto>[bisim] Q \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       P \<leadsto>[bisim] Q \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       P \<leadsto>[bisim] Q \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q

proof (state)
this:
  P \<leadsto>[bisim] Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       P \<leadsto>[bisim] Q \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q

proof (prove)
using this:
  P \<leadsto>[bisim] Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<leadsto><bisim> Q

proof (state)
this:
  P \<leadsto><bisim> Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       P \<leadsto>[bisim] Q \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q

proof (state)
this:
  P \<leadsto><bisim> Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       P \<leadsto>[bisim] Q \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q

proof (state)
this:
  bisim \<subseteq> weakBisim

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       P \<leadsto>[bisim] Q \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q

proof (chain)
picking this:
  P \<leadsto><bisim> Q
  bisim \<subseteq> weakBisim

proof (prove)
using this:
  P \<leadsto><bisim> Q
  bisim \<subseteq> weakBisim

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q

proof (state)
this:
  P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q

goal:
No subgoals!

proof (state)
this:
  ?P \<leadsto>[bisim] ?Q \<Longrightarrow> ?P \<leadsto><weakBisim> ?Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<simeq> Q

proof (prove)
using this:
  P \<sim> Q
  ?P \<leadsto>[bisim] ?Q \<Longrightarrow> ?P \<leadsto><weakBisim> ?Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<simeq> Q
by(blast intro: unfoldI dest: Strong_Late_Bisim.bisimE Strong_Late_Bisim.symmetric)

lemma congruenceWeakBisim:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi

  assumes "P \<simeq> Q"

  shows "P \<approx> Q"
let ?X = "{(P, Q) | P Q. P \<simeq> Q}"

proof (state)
this:
  (P, Q) \<in> {(P, Q) |P Q. P \<simeq> Q}

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<approx> Q

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. \<And>P Q.
       (P, Q) \<in> {(P, Q) |P Q. P \<simeq> Q} \<Longrightarrow>
       P \<leadsto>\<^sup>^<({(P, Q) |P Q. P \<simeq> Q} \<union>
                             weakBisim)> Q
 2. \<And>P Q.
       (P, Q) \<in> {(P, Q) |P Q. P \<simeq> Q} \<Longrightarrow>
       (Q, P) \<in> {(P, Q) |P Q. P \<simeq> Q}

proof (state)
this:
  (P, Q) \<in> {(P, Q) |P Q. P \<simeq> Q}

       (Q, P) \<in> {(P, Q) |P Q. P \<simeq> Q}

this:

  fixes P :: pi
  
  shows "P \<simeq> P"

proof (prove)
using this:
  ?P \<approx> ?P

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P. P \<leadsto><weakBisim> P

proof (state)
this:
  ?P \<leadsto><weakBisim> ?P

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<simeq> P

proof (prove)
using this:
  ?P \<leadsto><weakBisim> ?P

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<simeq> P

proof (state)
this:
  P \<simeq> P

No subgoals!

lemma symetric:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi
  
  assumes "P \<simeq> Q"
  
  shows "Q \<simeq> P"

proof (prove)
using this:
  P \<simeq> Q

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. Q \<simeq> P

lemma transitive:
  fixes P :: pi
  and   Q :: pi
  and   R :: pi
  
  assumes "P \<simeq> Q"
  and     "Q \<simeq> R"
  
  shows "P \<simeq> R"
have Goal: "\<And>P Q R. \<lbrakk>P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q; Q \<leadsto><weakBisim> R; P \<approx> Q\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> R"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q R.
       \<lbrakk>P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q; Q \<leadsto><weakBisim> R;
        P \<approx> Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> R

proof (prove)
using this:
  eqvt weakBisim
  ?P \<approx> ?Q \<Longrightarrow> ?P \<leadsto>\<^sup>^<weakBisim> ?Q
  ?P \<approx> ?Q \<Longrightarrow> ?Q \<approx> ?P
  \<lbrakk>?P \<approx> ?Q; ?Q \<approx> ?R\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> ?P \<approx> ?R

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>P Q R.
       \<lbrakk>P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q; Q \<leadsto><weakBisim> R;
        P \<approx> Q\<rbrakk>
       \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> R

proof (state)
this:
  \<lbrakk>?P \<leadsto><weakBisim> ?Q; ?Q \<leadsto><weakBisim> ?R;
   ?P \<approx> ?Q\<rbrakk>
  \<Longrightarrow> ?P \<leadsto><weakBisim> ?R

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<simeq> R

proof (chain)
picking this:
  P \<simeq> Q
  Q \<simeq> R

proof (prove)
using this:
  P \<simeq> Q
  Q \<simeq> R

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P \<simeq> R

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q \<and> Q \<leadsto><weakBisim> P;
     Q \<leadsto><weakBisim> R \<and> R \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> R \<and>
                      R \<leadsto><weakBisim> P

proof (prove)
using this:
  P \<simeq> Q
  Q \<simeq> R

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<lbrakk>P \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q \<and> Q \<leadsto><weakBisim> P;
     Q \<leadsto><weakBisim> R \<and> R \<leadsto><weakBisim> Q\<rbrakk>
    \<Longrightarrow> P \<leadsto><weakBisim> R \<and>
                      R \<leadsto><weakBisim> P
by(blast intro: Goal dest: congruenceWeakBisim symetric)

proof (state)
this:
  P \<simeq> R

goal:
No subgoals!
